etymologies: late 17th century: alteration of Arawak aru-aru (literally ‘meal of meals’) by association with arrow and root, the tubers being used to absorb poison from arrow wounds

definitions: a West Indian herbaceous plant from which a starch is prepared.
shortDefinitions: herbaceous Caribbean plant from which starch is prepared

definitions: the fine-grained starch obtained from arrowroot, used in cooking and medicine.
shortDefinitions: fine-grained starch obtained from arrowroot, used in cooking and medicine
